title: Courte
shortDesc: A mobile application that facilitates the use and sharing of tennis courts.
longDesc: Courte is a mobile application that offers a comprehensive solution to facilitate the use and sharing of public tennis courts by enabling users to find the closest parks with available courts, manage queues and connect with nearby users to play together. Courte's front-end was built using React Native with Expo along with the Native Base component library. Courte utilizes the devices native features, including location and maps.

As a full-stack developer for this project I integrated user authentication with Firebase Auth and Google OAuth provider with the login flow. I integrated the Google Maps SDK with our application in order to display dynamic park data pulled from MongoDB via Graphql queries.

This project was created from concept to delivery in just 12 weeks, this would not have been possible without this talented team. Thank you to our UI/UX designer Bruna Weiss and to fellow developers Gabriel Watanabe, Jaspreet Bhatti, Mizuho Tohma and Yebin Cho for making Courte possible!

title: Courte Server
shortDesc: AWS EC2 hosted server running on Node.js with Express and Graphql.
longDesc: Courte is a mobile application that offers a comprehensive solution to facilitate the use and sharing of public tennis courts by enabling users to find the closest parks with available courts, manage queues and connect with nearby users to play together.
Courte's server was built with Node.js, express.js and GraphQL apollo, and is hosted on an AWS EC2 instance.

As a full-stack developer for this project I integrated user authentication with Firebase Auth, Google OAuth provider, and server-side JWT token validation with Firebase Admin. I configured our primary GraphQL schema along with our Apollo Server, integrating it with Mongoose schema to connect to our primary database, MongoDB Atlas.

title: www.courte.app
shortDesc: A Next.js powered website hosted with Vercel.
longDesc: Courte is a mobile application that offers a comprehensive solution to facilitate the use and sharing of public tennis courts by enabling users to find the closest parks with available courts, manage queues and connect with nearby users to play together. Courte's landing page was built with Next.js and Styled Components. The site is hosted with Vercel.

title: Picbeak
shortDesc: A web application that provides educational information about bird species.
longDesc: www.picbeak.com is a youth-focused web application that provides educational information about region specific bird species. Users can identify birds they spot in the wild and add them to their personal virtual Beakpedia collection to track their progress and unlock new features.
In just 12 weeks, this project was created from concept to launch. During this project I served as both Project Manager and Front-End Developer.

As a front-end developer for this project, I developed stateful and streamlined front-end React functional components and interfaced with REST APIs via Axios requests to access and display dynamic data for users. I focused on the 'Identify' feature of the application and responsive header navigation. This was accomplished while collaborating with design and development team members in an Agile environment, going from concept to MVP in 13 weeks.

title: Scave
shortDesc: Scave is a location-based web app that facilitates the donation of goods.
longDesc: Scave is a location-based progressive web application that utilizes Google Maps JavaScript API along with geo-location services and Firebase Firestore to facilitate the donation and pick-up of goods within communities. Users create an account and post items for donation and/or explore items in their area to pick up and claim.

As a developer on this project I implemented the Google Maps JavaScript API along with customized Markers to display real-time user generated data and integrated Algolia search with front-end interace to allow for typo-tolerant searches on Firebase data. Additionally, I built the 'List Item' form utilizing HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, sending data to Firebase to be displayed on the map interface.

This project was created alongside a team of students at Langara College as part of the Web and Mobile App Design and Development Program (WMDD). During this project I served as both Project Manager and developer.

title: Wordpress Theme
shortDesc: A custom Wordpress theme developed using PHP and Sass.
longDesc: This site utilizes a custom WordPress theme that I designed and developed. The theme includes custom content loops on the front-page and as well as custom post data and post-type integration.
For preliminary wireframes and mock-ups I used Adobe Illustrator. For live implementation I used php, Sass and jQuery.
